docs.lead_paragraph: Gen. Wesley K. Clark emerged today as a target in the crowded field of Democratic presidential hopefuls, while Howard Dean continued to be criticized by his rivals over Medicare. General Clark, who emerged relatively unscathed from last week's debate involving the 10 Democratic contenders, was pounded by some of his rivals, who questioned his commitment to the Democratic Party and to privacy protections for Americans.

headline.main: Democrats Discuss Programs But Leave Time for Bickering

docs.abstract: On Sunday talk shows, Gen Wesley K Clark emerges as target in crowded field of Democratic presidential hopefuls; Howard Dean continues to be criticized by his rivals over Medicare; photo (M)
